title: Boris Johnson Wants a Brexit Election. He May Not Get It.
text:
LONDON—The first time British Prime Minister Boris Johnson urged the main opposition Labour Party to trigger an election to clear a path to Brexit, last month, his advisers were confident Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn would comply.

“What the f— are they going to say?” asked Dominic Cummings, Mr. Johnson’s senior adviser, according to a person present. Mr. Corbyn said no. He said no a second time last month. And as Mr. Johnson now tries to get an election called for a third time, in a vote scheduled for Monday, the Labour leader...
description: As Prime Minister Boris Johnson tries for a third time to get an election called, in a vote scheduled for Monday, it isn’t clear whether Labour will support the motion—and if it doesn’t Conservatives will need a different tack.
